Sashimi- I had specified for the fatty fish to come out last and even so they brought out the fish in all the wrong order.... What kind of a true sushi chef brings out the o-toro before the white fish ?! Mixed thoughts on the fish ... Although fresh they were mediocre quality because the flavor just wasn't there. Also, rice fell apart and wasn't great. 

Service: nice, friendly, and made up for their mistakes by bringing out additional dishes/ sake but I was expecting a top quality traditional Japanese meal. If I wanted Americanized Japanese cuisine I could have very well gone elsewhere. 

Bottom line: If you're looking for a neighborhood place to kick back and have a beer/sake with some friends while snacking on some rolls, Tsubasu has a good atmosphere for it. If you're looking for a traditional Japanese meal, this isn't the place for you.
author: Amanda L.

description: A San Francisco gem !! Consistent, affordable, delicious.
author: E. H.

description: Stumble upon this place after my haircut in Hayes Valley. I had a spider roll and a Hamachi nigiri . The sushi is very fresh and the sushi rice tasted good. I haven't explore the menu enough to give a fair rating but what I ate tasted good. The waitress and the sushi chef is very attentive and fast so nothing to complain. Definitely will go back with my hubby so we can try more foods.
author: Becky K.

description: Super yummy sushi! We came here for dinner before heading to Davies Symphony Hall for a show. We didn't have reservations, but they were kind enough to seat us at the counter (this was around 6:15pm). The food was delicious and fresh and our servers were so sweet. We'll definitely be back!!
author: Claire M.

description:
Wonderful low key sushi spot..amazing and fresh..imported daily and high quality! If it was a weekend night I would recommend a reservation! Very small but great San Fran find! Will definitely come back next time we are in the city! A plus, it was very reasonably priced! 

12 pieces of special nigiri 
2 rolls 
Plus drinks 
And tip came out to $110!!
author: Lexi C.

description: I am so glad to be introduced to Tsubasa, My husband and I are major sushi fans, we can literally eat sushi DAILY. Their sashimi were fresh, their sushi rice was on par to those in Japan. I ordered the 12 pieces omakase, and I was NOT disappointed at all. I indulged in EVERY pieces of chef choice nigris and it was only $68! The weekend before I tried Tsubasa, my husband and I were at some top notch sushi place in downtown SF and it's 138 per person for omakase (and not as good as Tsubasa)! Needless to say, Tsubasa is now on top of my SF/bay area sushi list, and I'll definitely will come back again and again.
author: Nikole X.

description: update: there is a pokestop right on the corner where Tsubasa resides. Come for the amazing sushi, stay for the pokemon.
author: Bo M.

description: Tsubasa is honestly so good & so underrated! The sushi chefs here definitely know what they are doing & are so sweet. I got the 12 piece omakase and the fish was so fresh and delicious. I'd for sure recommend this place to anyone and I love the fact that this place isn't super pretentious like other sushi joints. Also, their prices are very reasonable for the amazing quality that you get. If you haven't been here yet, go try it ASAP
author: Emily U.

description: Consistently great. I suppose at this price point there are a bunch of sushi places that will probably be fine, and we could argue for hours on what exactly five stars means any more, but this place works for me. Great miso, uncommonly prepared maki, and interesting sashimi options? Check. Just need to come back more often.
author: Aaron G.

description: Really great sushi place with high quality fish.  And the place isn't stuffy or overly formal, or even that pricey compared to other high quality sushi joints in SF.  Highly recommend!
author: Candice B.

description: So good. Had the sushi mariawase lunch special and the 5 piece chefs choice was just soooo delicious. Each piece was beautifully made and the seasoning was just right.
author: Kerr T.

description: My friend and I came here on a Tuesday night. We arrived at 7:30pm and were seated immediately even though our reservation was 8:00pm. The place is not too big and the ambience was quiet and lovely. The servers were very friendly and attentive throughout the night. They even recognized my friend who had been there for only three or four times. We ordered the Zensai sanshu for appetizer as our server recommended as well as the 12 peices nigiri Omakase and they were fantastic. Each piece was very unique, fresh, and flavorful. Wonderful experience!
author: Winnie C.

description:
Tsubasa is good.  How good?  Good enough that I feel conflicted about writing a review on yelp, fearing that i will never be able to get a seat myself anymore.  

Simply put, the fish is top quality, the rice is perfectly cooked, and the seasonings are on point.  And for the $60, 12-piece omakase, they served uni and giant clam (!), 2 of my favorites that usually never come as part of the prefix.  That is very, very generous.

As I foresee this place taking off like Saru and the likes in SF, I will treasure my time to be able to still drop in without a reservation, for as long as I can.
author: Jiajia C.

description: Came here for dinner and the food was great. Don't miss the dessert. Also lovely staff. Definitely recommended
author: Niaz S.

description:
Tsubasa was recommended to me through a friend. And last night I finally made a trip out to Hayes valley, WARNING: prepare to hunt down a parking spot. 

This review is mainly for the IKURA, which was bomb.com. It was house cured and I definitely appreciate that. I would come back just for this alone. 
We also ordered the 15 piece sashimi ($60) it came with blue fin tuna, scallop, kurodai, king salmon and I forgot the 5th one. All the pieces were good, but I wasn't completely blown away. They did not have any uni so I was quite sad. But the chef gave up a complementary grilled eggplant appetizer to make up it, it was surprisingly good.

I'll be back again, for the ikura alone.
author: Evelyn L.

description: This sushi spot is a hidden gem in sf. It's hard to find an authentic/traditional sushi bar that has a fair price range in the city. Highly recommended - sit at the sushi bar and meet Wilson (sushi chef). Tell him what you enjoy and he'll cater your meal to that. We spent $114 (incl taxes) for 2 and had omakase, 2 rolls, uni nigiri, and wine. Also had some complimentary appetizers/desserts which were delicious and a nice surprise :) Definitely coming back!!
author: Eileen W.

description: Replacing another sushi spot in Hayes Valley, Tsubasa is a new Japanese restaurant that offers both omakase as well as a la carte sushi. They definitely still have some kinks to work out in the kitchen and with the service. I had the 8 piece nigiri omakase. It comes out 4 at a time, unlike the piece by piece omakase at all the high end omakase spots in San Francisco. The quality of the fish was great, but the fish was sliced too thinly, making the placement awkward on the rice. I also tried the futomaki, which uses a soy wrapper instead of the traditional seaweed wrapper. I thought the flavors were great, and I loved the addition of the unagi in there. I wasn't entirely opposed to the dining experience and would definitely give Tsubasa another chance in the future, once they've worked out some of their issues.
author: Ashley T.

description: We had reservations for 4 at 6pm.  We arrived promptly and were seated, we let our server know upon her asking that had to attend a show at 7:30.....our food arrived slowly at 7:10 pm and not at the same time for all of us!  Service was slow and plates arrived one at a time making our party awkwardly eating fast and at different times.  We barely made it to the show close by (fortunately).  Tsubasa used to have better service.  Food was good, portions were tiny but not worth the wait.  It was our last time eating there.
author: Nuria M.

description:
Fish was not fresh. I will not go back to this sushi restaurant.

I walked into the place, and there was a overwhelming fishy smell

None of the fish tasted fresh. The staff seemed like they were unknowledgeable - and were pretending to know about sushi. Poor service.

Bottom Line: bad sushi because the fish is not fresh - bad service. Do not come here for sushi. 

I would give it 0 stars if I could.

Bad sushi.
author: James E.

description: mmmm, i thought this place was just ok.  came in last night for the 12-pc omakase dinner. while i enjoyed most of the pieces and i thought the fish to rice ratio was good, nothing was outstanding.. i cant really tell you what i had, which is not a great sign.  the price is quite reasonable - $60 for the 12 pieces, so i would probably come back to try it out again.
author: Christina L.

description:
When you get sick of eating the same sushi, like tuna, salmon, eel, etc., go to a real restaurant. Tsubasa. They get the finest fish from around the world and it is prepared to perfection.  The Arctic Char and Amberjack are simply fantastic. And order the Seared Mackerel. Excellent. If you HAVE to have a roll, get the Holy Crab. Holy Moly indeed!

Do leave those bad habits of dunking the fish in soy sauce before you eat it. The chef will chop your hand off if you try it (not really, but you'll ruin the fish and the whole point of eating sushi in the first place).

Unless you know what you're doing, stay away from the belly stuff. Those fish are an acquired taste.

Oishi!
author: Joe E.

description: I'd give it zero if that was an option. Although we  came in a party of 6, which understandably they didn't have enough space to sit, we saw an available two seats and another four seat table. Even though we proposed to split our group, they still refused to sit us.
author: Rajiv A.

description: Wouldn't seat a party of 6 even though we offered to split up. All because we are friends
author: Sonny F.

description: My husband and I loved the food presentation and service was excellent. The fishes were fresh and tasted great. Additional bonus: They gave us complimentary green tea ice cream after they learnt we were celebrating my husband's birthday.
author: Maya L.

description: Superb dinner - authentic and extremely high quality sushi by skilled Japanese chefs. Impressive in all respects. A bit pricy but in this case, you get what you pay for. Wow!
author: Bob D.

description:
Amazingly fresh fish and by far the best sushi in Hayes valley. A bit pricey but worth it.

We did the 8-pc Omakase with favorites being the barracuda (kamasu), Black Sea bream (kurodai), blue fun tuna, chu-toro, flounder (hirame) and wild amberjack (kanpachi).

Service is also great and we got seated quickly.

Will definitely be back!
author: Farid V.

description: Wild. Fresh. Not frozen. Tsubasa is hands down one of the best sushi restaurants in Hayes Valley. They pride themselves on serving fresh wild fish. They have a great variety as well as some of the standards. But definitely get something off the wild menu. Everything is beautifully prepared and plated at just the right temperature. Ask for a belly and have it lightly seared for a melting experience.
author: Phil M.

description: The food is pretty decent! I can't believe I've never been here before since I live in the neighborhood and  have passed by this place so many times....there's no significant sign outside at all...not at all...if it's not I searched on Yelp I'll never know that there's a sushi restaurant there. Please put up some kind of sign out there please!!
author: Porscha Y.

description: Went to go to THe One sushi but it was closed and this place was there instead. Pleasantly surprised, the sushi was DELICIOUS, service was good, and prices were pretty reasonable. About $35 / person including some sake. The menu is small which makes choices easier, and the place was simple and fast. Will certainly return.
author: Jordan C.

description: Never disappoints! Great service, amazing value and freshest seafood. Their menu changes based n the fresh fish they get from the markets. All the nigiri tastes great and have complex flavors. I never even need to use soy sauce or wasabi because the sushi is already perfectly seasoned. My favorite place in SF for nigiri and sashimi. Rolls were great too!
author: Jessica L.

description: The fish is super fresh and melts in your mouth. We got the omakase and the butterfish.
author: Tran N.

description: Amazing sushi. The kind you dream about. Wish you knew about and almost don't want to tell anyone else exists. Basically some of the best Sushi  in San Francisco.
author: Tao G.

description: Definitely my new fave sushi spot in town! We stumbled into Tsubasa randomly. Hungry and thirsty after a walk from NoPa, we were seated in 10min on a Friday night. We ordered a few items on top of the 8 piece omakase. Our food came out relatively slowly, but everything tasted so good! The fish was super fresh and excellent quality, which makes the value/price ratio quite awesome! We came back with friends the following weekend after our delightful first experience. We ordered a ton of food and everyone loved it! My picky-eater boyfriend even liked some of the fish that he normally wouldn't eat and decided to become a regular here. The chef even offered us complimentary sake! We left with happy bellies and feeling all around magical. Coming back here soon!
author: Nana L.

description: Definitely a great experience. If you order omakase they throw in little dishes in between (I recall an eggplant and candied tomato). Sushi is pretty solid, but not the best I've had. The service is phenomenal. Very good prices!
author: J L.

description: Not sure about the 4.5 stars more like a 4 star. We ordered a beer and sake and the first thing the server said is "we do not do sake bombs here" I looked at him like and said, "do we look like kids or college kids that would do that?" It may be subjective, but the impression the staff gave me is that this is not my type of crowd to come back to. Would I go back. Maybe but there are several other sushi places to go to before I go back to this one. Sushi was ok. They had a great selection and variety of fish. Quality was overall a 3.8/5. Meaning room for improvement is there. They haven't reached their ceiling yet.
author: Miguel Y.

description: I'm absolutely amazed by this new spot. Thanks to a dear friend who promised to take me to a "great sushi", I must say the promise was highly kept! We had a few rolls that were delicious and to try something special we had the chefs appetizer - yummy and gorgeous! The service is remarkable. Perfect for a date, for a solo stroll and for a friends-get-together!
author: Valentina G.

description: INCREDIBLE food and presentation. Got the omakase and enjoyed every piece. Hands down favorite sushi place in SF!
author: Naomi B.

description: Come with my friends from South Cal and was looking for sushi place, this place is delicious and I will definitely return.
author: Collin N.

description: We talked in for a snack when half of the restaurant was empty. Yet they told us that they couldn't seat us for even 10-15 mins. The customer service was incredibly rude. Will not come back again for a snack or dinner .
author: Jennifer D.

description: Came here with my family - we were a group of 10 (3 adults and 7 kids) and they refused to seat us even though they had two tables available that could fit us. The head chef and hostess said 'No' outright to us because i assume that they didn't want to seat a family with a lot of kids. Can't believe that happened - that has never happened to me in all my years of eating out. That is just straight discrimination. Unbelievable in this day and age. I would give it zero stars if possible.
author: Wilson L.

description: Solid sushi place and good value for the money. Good quality sushi and friendly staff. Would go back.
author: Y E.

description:
Probably one of the worst sushi I ever had. 

I came here because of "Michelin recommended". However, I found that this is just  another Chinese owned casual Japanese restaurant, that means, they care about "making more money" than "making good food",  no one speak Japanese but English with Cantonese accent , if you want to try omekase and don't want to pay top dollars, this is your choice, the food is not the best in Bay Area: Miso soup was watered down, served with a spoon (not  a Japanese way); each nigiri was just  a very tiny and  thin piece of fish and was pre-marinated, which made me not able tell if the fish was fresh or not; chawamushi was just simply steam egg with no flavor.....the presentation was nice but the taste of food was not authentic, for people who don't know anything about sushi, it's a "good place", besides, the  chef was wearing gloves when making sushi , it looks sanitized but not sure if he changed them when making a different sushi, the wrinkles of gloves could have harbored  many bacterias already. After all the  price was cheap compared to other upscale Japanese restaurant in Bay Area, the service is pretentious, slow but ok. I won't recommend this place for sushi to anyone.
author: Shan S.

description:
The freshest sushi I've ever had! The restaurant was very clean. Definitely worth it if you're seeking a special sushi experience. After having the Omakase, my boyfriend and I asked the chef to surprise us. The Chef, Wilson, and the entire staff were very friendly and welcoming. We had a blast trying all of the chef's recommendations, chatting with the staff and drinking a little too much sake (which was also amazing). Oh, and the arctic char was to die for!

Would highly recommend & will definitely be back!
author: Lexi C.

description: We both ordered the 12 piece Omakase, it was amazing! One of the best and great place to go before symphony or opera.
author: Leah C.

description:
Apparently this place was opened only 1.5 months ago. We sat at the bar and it was great interaction with the sushi chef.

The seafood were really fresh and prices quite reasonable. Good sake selection as well. Good location to the theaters.
author: JayJay L.

description: Came to this nice and well-designed Japanese restaurant with my friends for the first time. The service was great and the food was fresh and delicious. My favorite was the crab and egg. The menu had the date printed so I believe they change menu daily, which is excellent. Will return again.
author: Ella Z.

description: Went here for my birthday with the boyfriend and had a fantastic meal. The servers and chefs were very attentive to our needs and made sure we had a great night there. We went for the 12 piece omakase and I thought it was great for its price point. The rice was delicious and the fish tasted fresh! On top of our 12 piece meal, the chef offered us some monkfish liver on the house as well as matcha ice cream (for my birthday). To top everything off, all the workers joined in together to sing happy birthday to me. They definitely made my experience the best it could be. Everyone should check this place out because it is definitely worth it!
author: Jacqueline H.

description:
They source some damn fine fish, some juicy roe, and the rice texture and temperature is fantastic.

Tsubasa is still pretty new so they're ironing out the operational kinks, but I look forward to coming back to sample the high quality staples (hamachi, uni, etc) as well as some of the more seasonal sashimi/nigiri. Who knew it was baby octopus season?
author: Ben M.

description: First time Omakase and worth every penny! We had the 12 piece nigiri set and the chef gave us an extra eggplant appetizer, monk fish, and free ice cream! Ten out of ten on a delicious scale
author: Sam C.

description:
A hidden gem in Hayes Valley! The 12 piece nigiri omakase is a great deal in the city, with fresh fish flown in from Japan. Chef Wilson is friendly and makes a meal at the sushi bar an incredible experience, with complimentary appetizers and unique desserts. The highlight of my meal would be the uni at the end of the omakase. It is heaven in a few bites! :) 

I'd give Tsubasa 6 stars if I could. 5 for the tasty food and a bonus star for Chef Wilson and his incredible team!
author: Vanessa L.

description: Stellar service and great food. My friend and I had a bad experience at O-toro Sushi and left after waiting 30 minutes for a table. Tsubasa was able to accommodate us. The rolls are great and the steamed egg was delicious. They also gave a few dishes, compliments of the chef, that were very good. Will definitely be coming again.
author: Cathy C.

description: Came following a matinee showing of the SF Symphony, looking forward to some quality Japanese food for lunch to impress our visiting relatives.  Unfortunately, we were refused seating even though we were willing to split into two separate tables (that WERE available).  I have never been so shocked AND embarrassed by such inhospitality - we did not make a scene though we should have, we were in such disbelief - when was the last time you were simply refused service?  Has never happened to me in all my years and travels around the world, including Japan.  Papito's around the corner, though busy, greeted us happily and without any reservation.  Find another place for Japanese food - don't support this restaurant's behavior that gives 'discriminating customers' a whole new meaning. Absolutely unacceptable and leaves a bad taste in my mouth, no matter how good their food might be.
author: Eva C.

description:
Tsubasa is really good at making their sushi look pretty and plating everything to look like they are high quality. I was a bit disappointed by the quality of their fish and just overall taste and experience of the meal :( my boyfriend and I ordered the chef's choice sashimi for $40 with a side of sushi rice, battera roll, hamachi nigiri, one of their special chefs choice appetizer (shoyu ikura, Maguro, and monkfish liver), and spicy albacore hand roll. The chefs choice sashimi was the most disappointing.. Because the sashimi didn't taste as buttery (a bit chewy) and did not have any taste to it (very bland and no dimension- would have tasted better if it was brushed with ponzu). The sushi rice on the side was dry. The battera roll which included Saba and pickled kelp was very very salty, Though I liked the concept of pickling kelp..the mackerel also had some bones left in it. The chefs appetizer was placed so beautifully..However, lacked taste. Because we did not feel satisfied from the meal, we decided to order a hamachi nigiri which took them 25 more minutes to serve to us. The only thing I absolutely enjoyed was the spicy albacore hand roll- probably one of the best I've ever tried. They season the spicy albacore mix with grilled onion which gives it the tangy, savory taste. Other positive notes were the edamame tofu they give you on the house before the meal, and the house sweet potato dessert they give you at the end. 

All in all, I think this restaurant is very ambitious, knows how to set up a great ambiance, and aims to serve beautiful looking food- but the food tastes lack luster :( I left the restaurant not feeling full or satisfied, and like I had wasted my money. I would come back and give this restaurant a second chance- I'd probably try the nigiri mix and the spicy albacore roll :)
author: Tracey K.

description: The yellowfin appetizer was awesome, and this place had the best sake I've had outside of Japan.
author: Quarup B.

description: Poor customer service. Mediocre sushi. Had to ask for refills of water 3 times and there were only 3 other tables of customers. Staff wasn't friendly at all. You can definitely find better sushi and a better experience for your money.
author: Justin P.

description: awesome sushi and great service.  The fish was fresh and high quality.  Other dishes we ordered were unique in presentation and great in taste as well.  Server was very attentive although the place was super busy. Make sure you make an reservation before you go as I saw them turning away walk-ins due to the amount of customers they already had.
author: Lian F.

description: Not a good experience, everthing is salty and too much soysause. The cut of sushi and sashimi is so thin and not fresh, and i will not come back again.
author: Wayne Z.

description: My favorite sushi in SF...only downside is their reservation system with Yelp doesn't work well. Their yelp reservation site never seems to work so you have to go in person and wait in line.
author: James R.

description: Not the freshest or most creative... Just ok. There are other, better, spots that feel and taste better.
author: Doug L.

description: Love this sushi restaurant. It use to be the one sushi lounge that had horrible service. Now the service is amazing and the food too!
author: Jenny J.

description:
This place replaced one of our favorite sushi happy hour spots, I'm underwhelmed. The menu isn't as extensive, missing yummy things like gyoza & ahi poke. The staff there is wonderful and attentive!

We really wanted to like it, but it just wasn't great. The miso soup and seaweed salad was great, that's where it ended. The rolls lacked enough flavor & there wasn't as much of a variety as many places. We'll try it again, hopefully they improve.
author: S V.

description: Went here before seeing a show and it was great! The sushi was fresh and tasty and we enjoyed everything a ton. We enjoyed it so much we even ordered an extra roll. Only reason I didn't give 5 stars was because the portions are too small for the price.
author: Jessica M.

description: One of the best sushi dinners I have had in a while.We forgot to make reservation and had some miscommunication with the guy up front about putting our name on the list. Finally got a seat about 45 minutes later at the sushi bar. We started off with some simple rolls (Rainbow and Juicy Scallop) and Edamame which were all really good. Ended up doing the Omakase 8 piece and it was amazing. Mackerel, Arctic Char, Scallop, and the last piece was Fatty Tuna which was a first for me. Amazing fish and amazing sushi chef, who talked to us throughout. Best part of the night was after we finished, I was talking to the sushi chef about his favorite cut of fish and he mentioned Sardines, which I have never tried. He cut some up for me and let me try it .... absolutely amazing. Despite the wait time and bad start, the night was amazing. Will definitely come back next time I'm in SF.
author: Drew D.

description: This place is worth every star.  Expertly prepared sushi, imported straight from the land of the rising sun.  Top notch service.  This will be my official go-to-fancy-sushi spot.  A little pricey, but the quality is worth it.  I just saw a new feature when posting reviews...is there a poke stop.....Are you kidding me?  Is there a flipping poke stop?  I hope you choke if you take your phone out during a meal here.
author: Adam C.

description: We went to Tsusaba to try something new and thank god we did. First of all the staff here are AMAZING. The service was top notch and the chefs were very friendly. We ordered the omakase and it was probably the best I've ever had. We actually ordered a lot more after the omakase because the fish was really fresh. Everything was just on point. The seasoning on the fish, the rice on the nigiris, the sake. We will definitely be back very soon!
author: Alex P.

description: Amazing! We ordered 8 rolls and every single one was delicious... I usually can only eat maybe one roll because after that I start to feel full and a little sick. But even after eating so much I didn't feel full or sick at all. It was totally satisfying. I left feeling great, like I actually had just eaten food that was energizing. I have never been to a sushi place before and liked every single roll I ordered. We also had the octopus salad and tuna tataki, everything was great. Our server was also on point and prices are more than fair. Can't wait to go back!
author: Amy A.

description: Well the fish is fresh....where is the variety? I eat sushi on a daily basis........and I have to say to only have a few varities meaning tuna, salon and red snapper??? Come on.........The service was good and the chef was nice but I was not that impressed for a 70.00 lunch........too bad.
author: Amavi D.

description: We had such an amazing 2 hours dinner at the sushi bar with the head Chef Wilson celebrating my boyfriend birthday. We both ordered the 12 piece omakase, the zensai sanshu trio appetizer, and an unagi chawanmushi. The whole experience was nicely orchestrated. He started us with a house made edamame tofu to open pallet before starting the one by one hand crafted Nigiris. He started off with nice, clean, and light flavor white fishes then progress to more creamy and fattier flavor fishes. In between we were offered a very refreshing pallet cleanser of a cold and crisp Daishi broth eggplant. Nicely done. After a few more pieces of Nigiris, the chawanmushi came out. Which was a very nice intermission. We ended the omakase with a miso soup to wash it all down. Following with light dessert of a Japanese yam. Green tea ice cream with crunchy rice poppers and Mochi came last. Over all the staff was extremely nice. We had a great time chatting with Wilson. Every piece of nigiri was the right temperature and Texture with nicely added touches of sauce, garnishes or torching by the chef. Can't wait to be back for another great experience!
author: Nancy P.

description: The nigiri was so good, that the moment when the Saba melted in my mouth, it felt like the world became quite and peaceful; it also felt like being near the ocean hearing the song of waves; it is beyond description. Alhamdulillah, I ran into this place, and it turned out their nigiri is so touching to my heart that I felt like the world deserved to be treated gently and softly.
author: jian j.

description: I'm fairly certain my date and I did Tsubasa wrong by ordering rolls instead of Nigiri. We had spent a long day sightseeing and stopped in here based on glowing reviews and proximity to our hotel. We had been craving sushi for much of the trip and, despite noting that the nigiri menu was plentiful and included many unusual selections, we opted for rolls anyway to satisfy our persistent cravings. They were fine - nothing I would travel any particular distance for, but disappointing after much anticipation. The service also wasn't particularly attentive - we sat for 10 minutes before anyone even came to our table. Not a good look on a restaurant with 10 tables total. All in all, pricing was very reasonable and the meal was good. I'd like to re-visit and try some of the chef's recommendations, but given I was travelling it's unlikely I'll get the chance to come back. Look to other reviews on here for suggestions on what's great here - they've got to be doing something right with all those great reviews!
author: Stefanie C.

description: One of the best Sushi restaurants in the Bay Area. Amazing. Authentic. Delicious.
author: Luci G.

description: This is my favorite sushi stop in SF, hands-down. High-quality sushi, great ambiance, amazing staff. All of the nigiri/sashimi is amazing, the holy crab and juicy scallop are a must-have for rolls.
author: Eli B.

description: Fantastic!  Really great quality Japanese food, across the board.  The service is great, the atmosphere nice and relaxed, and the fish excellent.
author: Corey C.

description: We went with the 12 piece omakase. Each and every selection was incredibly fresh and seasoned to perfection. The sizes were generous and just so damn good we ordered some more nigiri a la carte afterwards. Tsubasa is an instant favorite and I can't wait to get back there again.
author: Asi B.

description: The food is always very fresh and I love the ambience. I recommend the eggplant appetizer and rainbow roll, although you can't really go wrong with anything there. Very friendly staff. Request for extra ginger was rewarded with a heaping bowl!
author: Venetia P.

description:
2 stars for the food - sushi was pretty fresh
minus 3 stars for the service - wait staff was completely incompetent 

I'm not sure how this place is going to survive.  This was easily one of the worst dining experiences I've ever had.

I met a friend for sushi, we both live in Hayes Valley and since this place had 4.5 stars we wanted to check it out.  

I am now guessing the 4.5 stars and 24 reviews = 24 reviews from friends/family

The service was horrendous:

Part 1: Drinks
I ordered a glass of Merlot, my friend ordered sake.  The waiter came back and told me the Merlot was out of stock, but that he had something very similar that was a cab/merlot blend.  I said that was fine.  He comes back and gives me and very light pinot noir, which is nothing like a cabernet/merlot, other than the fact that both are red wines.  Not the end of the world, but annoying when you were expecting something much darker.  My friend had to ask for her sake 2x before they actually brought it to our table.  When she wanted a refill, they charged her for 3 orders, instead of the 2 she actually ordered/received. 

Part 2: Food Order
We ordered miso soup, seaweed salad and some sashimi to start.  The waiter brought out our salad to share, but no plates.  When we asked for some plates, he said they would come out later.  We were very confused, and decide to just pick at the salad, sans plates.  We also never received the miso soup, and when we asked, the waiter said they would be coming out later.  Isn't miso soup meant to come out first???  While we were waiting for our sashimi, we ordered a roll as well.  

The sashimi was good, and the ONLY highlight of the meal, it was fresh and came out as ordered.  After we finished the sashimi, we sat there for another 20 minutes, until the waiter finally came over.  Instead of arriving with the roll we had ordered, he asked if he could start taking away plates.  We reminded him that we were waiting for our roll and STILL waiting for our miso soup.  He said "oh, yeah, okay, I forgot about the roll" and walked off to put in the order.  He quickly returned to our table, and said "I completely forgot what you ordered, can you tell me what you wanted again?" 

When I looked around at other tables, it was obvious that everyone was having a similar experience - incorrect orders, forgotten drinks, lack of plates/utensils.  

I will be surprised if this place lasts, I hope a better place takes over this spot.  They should consider hiring a competent wait staff to start.  I will not be back.  Incredibly disappointing and a complete waste of money.
author: Sichia B.

description: My boyfriend and I have eaten here five times or so now, and each time I'm more impressed with the quality and variety of the fish. The quality rivals that of some of my favorite places and at a shockingly better price. Sit at the bar and order the omakase sashimi and whatever is on the specials list. Don't be turned away if it doesn't seem packed. This place is a gem in a city where so many places are over hyped.
author: Marybeth B.

description:
So you know those fancy omakase places with the freshest sushi ever, but they cost like $100+ a person? This place is THAT QUALITY. No, really... It's that good. Know those mediocre sushi places that you go to because it's the only option for your weekly fix? It's along that price point. This is really the best sushi I've had in a very long time. If I didn't live in NYC, I'd be here twice a week. Beautiful fish and unique variety, a lot of which comes in from Japan and elsewhere daily. 
Wilson at the sushi bar is awesome, so is the staff and hostess! I have a feeling that this is going to end up on a lot of "best sushi/ top restaurants in SF" lists soon... Get in there before the reservation wait list is a month long!
author: Sandra H.

description: Service is really good. Good dry sakes for drink. I had battura sushi and STASH roll and they were so good. Miso soups are not too salty so that was delicious. I made a reservation and they had a table ready for us when we got there. I will definitely come back!
author: Justin W.

description: In a world full of critics. I must say, this place was fantastic. We came in due to the reviews and we were not disappointed. My husband raves it is perhaps the best sushi he has ever had and in our travels we've had a lot of sushi. They offered additional dishes from the chef you would not generally order when carving out room to eat your beloved dished and it was a wonderful and welcomed treat.
author: Ben L.

description: This used to be called The One Sushi and Lounge and was my go-to spot in Hayes Valley for sushi. It was my go-to sushi spot not because it was the best sushi in H.V., but because it was affordable, rarely packed, had a TV to watch a game, and had some fun rolls (49ers roll was my fave). They have rebranded it as Tsubasa, raised prices and gotten rid of the TV and the fun rolls! Now you can't watch the 49ers or eat a 49ers roll. They kept the mediocre sushi, changed the decor and upped prices. Not cool for me. Not my go-to spot anymore.
author: Sean D.

description:
Had the 12pc omakase with a bottle of sake and everything was fine, but was really disappointed that they didn't have uni or giant clam.  Wish they would've been upfront about this because I spent a decent amount on dinner and was not wowed by any means.  

The quality of the fish was good, atmosphere was nice, and service was ok.  Price for 12pc omakase is definitely hard to beat, but not sure if I'll come back unless I'm in the neighborhood.
author: klb l.

description: Husband and I came here on a Sunday evening. Very impressed with their nigiri. Great customer service, and high quality fish. This comes close to elephant sushi in Russian hill which is by far my favorite sushi restaurants in the city!
author: jessica t.

description: Spent an amazing evening there last Friday. I know one of the owners, Eileen, well from previous visits to one of her other Sushi places in the Marina--Naked. This past experience was by far the very best Sushi meal experience I have ever had--from the standpoint of quality and selection and preparation of fish to the service I could not have asked for more. Absolutely off the charts. It set a new standard for me. On par with Sushi Ran at far less the dent in your wallet. Great vibe...loved every minute of it!
author: Howard G.

description:
We came here for dinner to celebrate our anniversary. We had made reservations and explicitly requested to sit at the bar. When we arrived to check in to our reservations the hostess looked confused and we noticed that there was another reservation under the same name as us whom did not list a seating preference however our reservation had been crossed out instead of theirs. They had given away our seating to that couple however there were still seats next to them. Instead of giving us those seats she seated us all the way around the corner of the bar where not only was the view obstructed by a pole, dishware, but also saranwrap and miscellaneous items. The seating was worse than just getting a table. We requested to sit at the open seats where our original seats were supposed to be however we were promptly told "Do you know the chef?" "You see we have so many people requesting to sit at the bar" WTH the hostess looked at us as if we were being unreasonable when she was the one who mistakenly gave away our seating and not checked whether the proper patrons were seated. Once seated, another waiter did apologize instead of the hostess. They tried to offer sake, but we didn't drink so that was a bust.

The food was ok. The only dish that was good was the artic char and the medium fatty tuna. Certain dishes tasted too sweet and although sounded interesting the egg yolk and uni nigiri piece didn't taste good. 

For the money you spend here you would expect the service to be better. In my opinion the sushi found here could be found elsewhere. I can't say anything was special or memorable.
author: Daniel W.

description: This is my favorite sushi in San Francisco. If you care about great sushi this is the place for you. The sushi is impeccable the staff very attentive, the prices extremely reasonable and the beer cold. If you love to dunk your California roll in wasabi and monster roll covered in siracha mayo this won't be your spot.
author: Evin W.

description: I can not describe how incredible this place is. I finally walked by last week when they were open and had lunch. The rolls were good, the octopus and cucumber appetizer was so tasty! I was told their dinner menu changes daily so I came back that night for dinner. The menu was the same and they had an additions menu with a variety of sashimi and nigiri options, this is the one that changes daily. At first I was a little let down as I've never been a fan of either, I only ever get rolls. But I decided to try some anyway. I chose 2 to try. Simply AMAZING! So then I had the wonderful chef pick the rest of my dinner that night. I returned again tonight for dinner and once again had the pleasure of watching the chef so delicately slice the fish and make each piece of nigiri. Everything he made me was delightful and savory. Even the presentation is beautiful! The king salmon was just exquisite...melts in your mouth! can't wait to go back soon and treat my taste buds to nigiri heaven.
author: Amanda C.

description: I came here with 2 friends. The sushi and sashimi were fresh and beautifully placed.  We ordered omakase and some hand rolls.  It's yummy.  I'd highly recommend it.
author: Wing W.

description: Ate here tonight and it was some of the best sashimi I've ever had. Super fresh and served at the perfect temperature. Have you ever eaten sashimi that tasted like they just pulled it out of the freezer? That's not the case here. It was cool but super fresh. The blue fin tuna and king salmon melt in your mouth. We also tried several rolls and every one of them exceeded my expectations. The meal was a little pricey but well worth it! I'll definitely be back next time I'm in San Francisco.
author: Neill H.

description:
I'm pretty picky when it comes to sushi, and this is the best I've ever had, except for one high-end Kaiseki place in Tokyo. Chef Wilson Chang, who worked his way up from busboy in various restaurants, and trained with a Japanese Kaiseki master, eschews the lamentable trend in froo-froo rolls, concentrating on exquisite presentations of ultra-fresh, rare and unusual fish: multiple varieties of toro, baby squid, baby eel, baby hamachi, even barracuda. Each is presented with its own unique matched marinade, subtly bringing out the unique flavors of each fish. Soy sauce and wasabi are "verboten", and utterly unnecessary. 

Try the gorgeous Goldeneye Salmon, or the King Salmon, delicately blowtorched for just a few seconds for a hint of that grilled taste, layered on top of the intense salmon flavors. Finish the meal with macha or black sesame ice cream with house-made mochi dough (fresh daily) and crisp rice sprinkles. Sit at the sushi bar and go on a weekday, not Friday or Saturday: Chef Chang likes to take his time and not rush. Oh - and if you have a friend who likes froo-froo maki, they are available.  But be smart and go straight for the yummy fresh nigiri specials of the day.
author: Andrew C.

description: OMG....sushi TO DIE for.... SOOOO good!!!! I went with 3 friends and we ordered a little of EVERYTHING... all of us were in complete heaven.  And the chef sent out recommendations of his favorites.... Hands down BEST sushi I've ever had.   The staff was delightful - so friendly and eager for us to try their recommendations.  I will be back for sure!
author: Carly B.

description: This is by far my favorite sushi restaurant in San Francisco. The quality is superb the sushi is always so fresh! The food often looks more like art than a meal. The staff are always extremely friendly and sweet.  I would recommend letting the chefs pick out what you order they never go wrong!
author: Mary M.

description: Tsubasa prepares all of their sushi cuts with the level of delicacy expected of sushi chefs. So far, this is as close to Tsukiji grade as I've gotten in SF. Every other place has been a disaster but Tsubasa was amazing! Consistency of the sushi rice, size and cut of sashimi, and freshness was all top notch.
author: Linh T.

description: Wow... freshest, most flavourful fish since moving to SF! Can't ask for a better location.
author: Richard W.

description: We went there early December 2016 with six of us. We were seated for lunch and had decent sushi. We tried to go there recently at the end of March 2017 for lunch. There were five of us. They said they could only take 4 as there was no table for 5. We said okay. We could split our party to 2 and 3. They had a table for 4 open and no reserved sign on it. They wouldn't seat 3 there because it was not for 3. What is this? We will not go there again and be disappointed. There are plenty of great sushi restaurants around and in San Francisco!
author: Mary T.

description: I love this place. The sushi is super fresh and tasty. It's high quality and seasoned to perfection so you can skip the soy sauce and really enjoy the flavors of the fish itself. I quickly became a regular because it's awesome and the staff are great. Don't hesitate to check it out.
author: alaina K.

description: Amazing sushi. Very high quality fish with attention to detail and fantastic service. Don't waste your stomach space with rolls and go for the nigiri and other tasty treats. I highly recommend this place for an authentic Japanese sushi experience.
author: Monica C.

description: Best place to get sushi before a show at the symphony or opera. Quiet and nice ambience, great food.
author: Tracey K.

description: my friends and i came here for dinner before the symphony last night.  we wanted to get the 12 pc omakase, but the server thought we wouldn't have enough time, b/c we had a little over an hour.  instead, we got the 8 pc omakase and then ordered some other rolls.  the portion of the rolls here is big - like 8 pcs.  the stash roll was good, and the juicy scallop was interesting, but my fave was the pressed negi toro, which was seared on top.  the omakase definitely had interesting pieces of fish, and each was already seasoned.  hopefully i can try the 12 pc omakase next time.
author: Helen T.

description: Don't eat any of the nigiri with soy sauce. The chefs here create delicate flavor combos. The uni and hirame was heavenly.
author: Maryam M.

description: Only been here for lunch and once for take out lunch. Ordered the Bento Box Chicken Teriyaki and Spicy Tuna roll. Spicy Tuna was good. Chicken Teriyaki wasn't cooked in the teriyaki sauce. Sauce served on the side. It was ok. Take out lunch was the Sake Don which I liked a lot more. Will try them again one day.
author: Cheryl W.

description: Great, fresh sushi at amazing prices. Chef Wilson is the boss man.
author: C J.

description: Had dinner here last week at the sushi bar.  Had the nigiri tasting which was good.  Sushi pieces were large as well.  Would probably go back there again in a few months when they are a bit more seasoned.  Probably a 3.5 star place but will round up for the nice service.  Getting reservations at the restaurant was pretty easy which was surprising given the location in Hayes Valley.  Dinner for two for sushi and alcohol was about $200.
author: Joe P.

description: Best sushi I've had - move over Masa. This place is all about the fresh fish and friendly service. Each piece of nigiri comes with a unique coating and flavors (citrus, ginger and home made soy sauce toppings). I've been 4 times in the past 2 months and the experience only gets better each time.
author: Brett S.

description: A restaurant is about more than a meal.  Our treatment of others speaks volumes about whether we respect them.  Don't waste your time with this place.  I have never encountered anything like the women who work the front desk.  We waited 40 minutes for a table.   We walked around Hayes valley only returning at the instructed time.  When we came in one of the waitstaff instructed my wife that "you need to wait outside." We had waited outside patiently.  Her tone and hostility were unnecessary.  When going to enjoy a meal, an unprofessional and condescending attitude is unwarranted.  I imagine the owner would be disappointed by the way his staff treat the customers.
author: Bill G.

description:
We came here for dinner to celebrate our anniversary. We had made reservations and explicitly requested to sit at the bar. When we arrived to check in to our reservations the hostess looked confused and we noticed that there was another reservation under the same name as us whom did not list a seating preference however our reservation had been crossed out instead of theirs. They had given away our seating to that couple however there were still seats next to them. Instead of giving us those seats she seated us all the way around the corner of the bar where not only was the view obstructed by a pole, dishware, but also saranwrap and miscellaneous items. The seating was worse than just getting a table. We requested to sit at the open seats where our original seats were supposed to be however we were promptly told "Do you know the chef?" "You see we have so many people requesting to sit at the bar" WTH the hostess looked at us as if we were being unreasonable when she was the one who mistakenly gave away our seating and not checked whether the proper patrons were seated.

The food was ok. The only dish that was good was the artic char and the medium fatty tuna. Certain dishes tasted too sweet and although sounded interesting the egg yolk and uni nigiri piece didn't taste good. 

For the money you spend here you would expect the service to be better. In my opinion the sushi found here could be found elsewhere. I can't say anything was special or memorable.
author: Juju W.

description: I loved this place! We got the 12 piece nigiri, which was the chef's choice of fish. The flavor and textures were perfect in every bite. We also got the scallop roll and sake sampler, which were equally enjoyable. I will definitely be back.
author: Kevin M.

description: Fresh sushi, not too crowded, great service. Jackson was extremely attentive and accommodating. Highly recommend!
author: S. V.

description: I have become a regular visitor to this small, clean sushi restaurant whenever I get to SF.  Formerly called The One Sushi (and already excellent) they consistently serve the most fresh, delicious sushi you will find.  Their menu changes daily based on what is most available & fresh - which should give you an idea of just how wonderful the flavors and textures are.  It really is one of the best sushi restaurants I have found and highly recommend it.  I look forward to getting there every visit.
author: David G.

description: Been coming here 1-3x a week for quite sometime now.  Just wanted to quickly add, everything is still ridiculously amazing (no idea how Chef Wilson keeps getting better and better at his craft), and all the friends that I have taken here are absolutely in love with it as well.  Chef Wilson and his staff are dedicated to continuing great things in 2017.  Cheers to them on a successful 2016 and the Michelin Bib Gourmand!
author: Jefferson L.

description: Great sequence of food and such fresh fish. We liked the recommendations that the chef gave. We will come back.
author: Gary M.

description:
Horrid pretentious service.  Walked in around 9 w a date and was greeted by staff with "give me one minute".  No problem, the two of us stand at the host podium and check out the nice décor. 5 minutes go by, at least 25% of the tables in this small place are empty and clean.  10 minutes go by, I look at the empty wait list, the multiple staff leisurely check on other customers, yet completely ignore us.  15 minutes go by, we are still standing there, the guests dining next to the door start joking with us that MTS busses come by more often than the hosts.  Apparently their food was decent but the service also sucked.  We ask for a recommendation and go to another place down the street which was packed but had fantastic service.
This joint reminds me of the pretentious clubs that while empty on the inside like to create a huge line outside so everyone would think how exclusive they are.
Here is a clue on hospitality.  If you have open tables - sit your guests, it would make them comfortable, instead of standing in high heels.  Give them menus, this will take their minds off waiting and help save the server time when he gets there to take their order.   If you are busy (which you weren't) at least approach your guests and acknowledge their presence again.  You might even offer them a glass of water on this unusually hot night.  Seriously,  this would be unthinkable in any restaurant where I worked.
author: Sergei G.

description: Wow, had the great 12 piece omakase here for $60. I sat at the counter without a reservation, and the chef threw in a lot of extras, and provide another option when I didn't love a piece. Great experience, great hosts, and I will definitely be back. This is probably one of my favorite sushi places in the city.
author: Mr. X.

description: My favorite neighborhood sushi spot :) Jenny is the best!  Fish is very fresh, service is amazing. We have been going here since before it was recently renamed, and this place just keeps getting better with every visit.
author: Gautam J.

description: My new neighborhood go to. Went this evening and had the 12 piece omakase nigiri, chawanmusi, and chefs spoons (scallop, ankimo, and chutoro). Everything was so thoughtfully prepared and meticulous. At the end of our delicious meal we ordered an ikura, uni, and tamago. Unfortunately we were told they just sold out of uni and the ikura was not yet ready and needed to marinade more before being served. As disappointed as I was, I greatly appreciate their standard of excellence and refusal to serve anything below that standard. As we finished our tamago and wine, the server brought us two pieces of uni compliments of the chef who said the pieces were too small to be sold. That was the most considerate gesture and the uni was delicious. I will definitely be a regular here!
author: Samantha K.

description: Amazing. Sit at the bar and get omakase. Its such a great price for the quality of fish. I've been to Kusakabe, Maruya, Omakase, and Yume to say the least, so I know my sushi. You're welcome.
author: nikkita l.

description: The only reason I can see for this place being almost empty on a Friday night is that people don't know about it yet. The quality, preparation, and presentation of the fish are all outstanding. The five-piece omakase sashimi was legitimately some of the best sushi I've ever had in my life. The sushi quality actually outshines the standard complements (miso soup, seaweed salad, etc.), to the extent that they seem like part of a different cuisine. Once they iron out this minor unevenness, it's going to be impossible to get a table. Now forget you read this. Mine!
author: Joe V.

description: Tsubasa replaced The One, a favorite sushi restaurant, but it remains one of the best you can find.  I believe the menu is changed daily depending on what is the most fresh.  Sushi is masterfully prepared and absolutely delicious.  It will continue to be a favorite whenever we are in SF.  The staff is also very attentive and friendly.  Oh, and they actually make their own tamago which is absolutely out of this world.  If that alone is representative of their kitchen, it truly is outstanding.  One of the best and highly recommended.
author: LMarie G.

description: This place is a good example of what is wrong in a sushi restaurant. I had the sushi nigiri lunch special. Umm.. Excuse where is the food. 5 tiny pieces of flavorless nigiri I was told came pre flavored with no need for soy or wasabi arrived for $18.00. Give me a break. What I dislike is the presumptive idea that tiny plates are always worth it. Sometimes it is but not here. I had to go get some food after eating here. Something with flavor. Don't waste your money. I know never again for me.
author: Hackey S.

description: Quaint, charming and delicious! My sister and I had a wonderful dinner here. Sushi was fresh, creative and quick service. Highly recommend!
author: Laurie W.

description: Top notch service. High quality ingredients. Creative & unique. Best sushi ive had in San Francisco!!!!!
author: Elaine T.

description: What happened to The One??! - - My co-workers and I love this place when it was The One. But we just went in the other day and it looks the same, which is nice, clean and open. The staff seems the same, very nice especially the young lady with the ponytail who is always there, so very friendly. BUT the lunch options have changed...they don't offer as many options  for lunch now. They don't have any lunch appetizers and when I checked the dinner menu, no Tempura appetizer offered. The miso no longer has tofu. My bento box seemed smaller and they don't carry the saba with ponzu sauce anymore and my co-workers teriyaki salmon came with the teriyaki sauce on the side instead of cooked on the fish.... My co-workers and I were very disappointed because it seemed that the place looked the same and the staff was the same...but they trimmed down the food costs to make more money....sad because it was a great lunch option.
author: Jessica M.
